caption:
This photograph captures a somewhat dimly lit indoor scene featuring three men engaged in discussing the details shown on a large, multi-colored map that is pinned to a wall. The map appears to be sectioned into different colored zones, suggesting some sort of zoning or geographical analysis.

The man on the left is wearing a dark coat and glasses, and is pointing at a specific area on the map. The middle man, dressed in a lighter jacket and dark trousers, is looking closely at the map, seemingly in deep conversation with the left-hand man about the pointed area. The third man, on the right, is similarly attired in a dark sweater and glasses, standing slightly behind the other two, observing the discussion.

Around them, the roomâ€™s walls are light-colored, and on the same wall as the map are additional pieces of paper and posters. One visible poster features a person standing in a field, which might indicate the agricultural or environmental context of their discussion.

The overall atmosphere appears serious and focused, with the group likely engaged in a professional or planning-related task. The simple furnishing, like metal chairs seen in the foreground, suggests the setting is utilitarian, possibly an office or a planning department of a governmental or educational institution.
title: Thurston Strunk, center, president of the Virginia-Pocahontas Coal Company with headquarters near Richlands, Virginia, looks at a map of operations with two men (geologist and mining engineer) from Germany who want to open another mine and are prepared to offer long term financing.
